intro: Astiella antongilensis, commonly known as the Madagascar orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its unique floral structure and striking coloration. The plant typically grows in humid, shaded environments, often in forest undergrowth. Its flowers are small but intricate, with specialized structures that aid in pollination by specific insect species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Astiella antongilensis is considered a conservation concern.
